Afrikan Farms

[/vc_column_text][vc_separator type=”small” position=”center”][vc_column_text]

In Amersfoort, Mpumalanga Highveld, South Africa, the farming operation was established in the year 2000 by the Khanyile Family with the vision of establishing the family roots on a rural land that they can call their own, whilst developing a sustainable farming enterprise on the land.

number_of_columns=”one_column”][qode_elements_holder_item item_padding=”30px” vertical_alignment=”middle” advanced_animations=”no”][vc_column_text]

About Us

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][vc_separator type=”small” position=”left”][vc_column_text]

Afrikan Farms engages in intensive farming throughout its operations in an effort of utilising the full productive capacity of the land. Operations range from animal farming, which includes beef cattle farming, cattle feedlot, sheep rearing for meat and preserving a apple orchard. Afrikan Farms produces the following crops: maize, soya beans and hay. Maize and soya beans are produced through Afrikan Farms subsidiary called WeGrow Farming Enterprise.

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space]Read More[/qode_elements_holder_item][/qode_elements_holder][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css_animation=”” row_type=”row” use_row_as_full_screen_section=”no” type=”full_width” angled_section=”no” text_align=”left” background_image_as_pattern=”without_pattern”][vc_column width=”1/2″][qode_elements_holder number_of_columns=”one_column”][qode_elements_holder_item item_padding=”40px” vertical_alignment=”middle” advanced_animations=”no”][vc_empty_space height=”72px”][vc_column_text]

Our Different Departments

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][vc_separator type=”small” position=”left”][vc_column_text]From cattle (beef) farming and sheep farming, Afrikan Farms focuses largely on implementing sound managerial practices in order to increase productivity when it comes to their livestock. Afrikan Farms has been dedicated to implementing only the best farming practices when it comes to their crop farming, which has maize, soya beans and hay.[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space]Read More[/qode_elements_holder_item][/qode_elements_holder][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″ css=”.vc_custom_1495029312113{background-image: url(https://www.afrikanfarms.co.za/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/Afrikan-Farms-farm-divisions-cattle2.jpg?id=86) !important;background-position: center !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;background-size: cover !important;}”][vc_empty_space height=”580px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css_animation=”” row_type=”row” use_row_as_full_screen_section=”no” type=”full_width” angled_section=”no” text_align=”left” background_image_as_pattern=”without_pattern” background_color=”#211900″][vc_column][vc_empty_space height=”72px”][vc_row_inner row_type=”row” type=”grid” text_align=”center” css_animation=””][vc_column_inner][vc_column_text]

Contact Us

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][vc_separator type=”small” position=”center”][vc_column_text]

Address: 148 Plaas Kleinfontein, Amersfoort. 2490
Email: admin@afrikanfarms.co.za
Tel:  +27 (0)10 549 1068

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_empty_space height=”72px”][/vc_column][/vc_row]
